Panty And Stocking With Garterbelt.... Just saying the title out loud can already describe the messed-up weirdness of this show. Created by GAINAX, the creators of FLCL and Gurren Lagann, Panty And Stocking is a wild, fast-paced and raunchy anime comedy that will blow your logical senses through the window.
The story takes place in Daten City, a town that's located between Heaven and Hell and ghosts always pop out to terrorize the citizens. That's where Panty And Stocking come in, 2 angels who fight against ghosts and exterminate them for good. They live in the church with a priest named Garterbelt, who's like a combinationof the personalities of Afro Samurai and Black Dynamite in one and a green dog named Chuck, but in reality they got kicked out of Heaven due to their bad attitude and must kill ghosts in order to gain "Heaven Coins" if they want to go back to Heaven. The story in the show is not always straight-forward like in most animes, but for me it's OK, cause this show is no even meant to be taken seriously and it's mostly about Pant And Stocking killing ghosts and earning their Heaven Coins, but don't let this text fool you by thinking that is boring. The various ghosts that they encounter in the series are so fucking messed up, like in the first episode where Panty And Stocking must fight a ghost who is made out of poop. Yes you heard me... A ghost that was created by our own shit... Mother of god. The characters are also fucked up, Panty is an angel who has an incredible ability to fuck a lot of hot men and without ever getting an infection, while Stocking is a goth chick who loves to eat sweets but somehow she doesn't get diabetes and did I mention that their weapons are clothes? Stocking's weapon can turned into a katana and Panty's weapon can turn into a powerful gun with infinite ammo that makes Dante's weapons from Devil May Cry look shit in comparison. The other characters like Garterbelt are even more messed up than Panty and Stocking, as Garterbelt likes too.... Uh.. likes too..... You know what? I'll let you see the show and figure out yourself instead.


As you can probably guess by now, Panty And Stocking is full of sexual humor and pop culture references from the West. Hell, the animation in the show feels more like a cartoon in the US than Japan. The sexual humor is actually pretty funny, but only if you can handle this kind of humor cause not many people like this sort of thing and other sexual jokes can get a little too sensitive in later episodes and it also makes fun of popular movies like Indiana Jones, High School Musical and even Transformers gets mocked in one episode. The animation by GAINAX is surprisingly solid and I'm actually glad that the animators went for a more western style on the animation but with a little bit of anime style flavor too. The backgrounds look nice and the models are well animated with good animation movements in the action scenes. It also uses live action scenes with the each ghost that gets defeated and ends up exploding into pieces and it just awesome to look at. The action scenes are phenomenal, every action set-piece is thrilling and non-stop excitement that the sense of fun always will get you pumped for the nest one, but the finale in the series is the real show-stealer but I will not spoil it... Sorry. The music in Pant and Stocking is pretty cool, it offers some very solid music tracks that fits the show's badass attitude and the song "Fly Away"... Well, it makes wanna dance on a stripper pole for hours to come. The voice acting is solid, but the English dub by Funimation is definitely the best. The English script offers far more funnier dialogue than the Japanese version and the cast is better, since this show is more for western audiences than Japanese audiences. Jamie Marchi and Monica Rial are incredibly fun to listen as the main heroines and their performances are incredibly rich and strong in their roles. Christopher Sabat was awesome as Garterbelt with his tough-ass attitude that he gives to his character and the rest of the cast did solid with their roles they had to perform with their voices for the chosen characters.


If you haven't had the chance to see this show, I recommend this to anyone who wants to have a hell of a good time with this series. Panty And Stocking is just so damn entertaining that words are incredibly weak to describe the awesomeness of this show. If you want some negatives for this show, here are 2 negatives that I had with this show: 1. The plot is hit or miss and it confusing to understand it and 2. There's a lot of sexual humor and it may turn off some anime fans. But whatever, go see this show, cause it kicks so much ass that you won't even care for the problems for the issues the show has.

I had high expectations for this anime after reading the raving reviews about Panty and Stocking. Unfortunately after watching the first episode, I was too bored to watch. Panty and Stocking is probably the only anime to date I have dropped after watching the first episode, although I watched the second episode before writing this review to reaffirm my hatred.
Panty and Stocking has the same fatal flaw many live action comedy films fail in theaters. It’s purely a comedy series, yet it is not funny. Without humor the show has absolutely nothing. Some of the bits, such as blatantly obvious model monster explosions could haveworked for me if the rest of the show wasn’t so dull. A successful comedy should have you laughing more often than not. The momentum of hilarity can be more important than the value of a joke. Instead of laughing at the humorously overdone death animations, I was left spiting it along with the rest of the show. The sex jokes were overdone and I’ve grown past the age where I would laugh at something just because it was a piece of shit.\n
There is a large group of people who believe Panty and Stocking is a parody of how a majority of the animes produced are moe kawaii trash. One reviewer puts it as this: “To put it plainly, the entire point of this show is to take the illusions otaku have surrounded themselves with for the last 10 years and annihilate them through a wanton, infinite assault of sex and Western style”  \n
Really?\n
Not being a K-on, Strike Witches, or To Love-Ru automatically makes it a parody of stereotypical otaku culture? The show does nothing to address anything about waifus. It is just different. \n
And Panty and Stocking does have fanservice. Chuck is Gir. What other purpose does he serve other than reminding viewers of Invader Zim. Don’t pretend that just because the transformation scene could be a parody of other animu is enough to separate it from all the other scenes in animu just to please viewers.\n
Yes I hate Panty and Stocking. I could have found some of the other aspects of the show, such as it’s western style animation and music interesting but I don’t care because it failed to be funny. If there was any plot, at least there would be reason to watch more, but Panty and Stocking bet everything on humor and it didn’t work for me.\n

OH. MY. GOOOOODDDDDDDDDDDD.
This anime is purely AMAZING.
Two fallen angels, one who is addicted to sweets, and another who is addicted to sex. 
Making fun of the cartoon network style, and about as much ecchi as you can get. It's perfect. It's insane, hilarious and adorable all at the same time.
What more can you ask for? A pefect soundtrack with epic music. Oh wait, nevermind. They already have that. The characters are all epic. There's the wild party-type girl, Panty. The cutesy gothic girl, Stocking. The strict girl, Kneesocks. The snob, Scanty. The nerdy boy, Brief. The pet animal thingy, Chuck. And then last but notleast, the priest with alot of things sterotyped as "very unreligious". \n
I reccomend this if you really want some LOLs.

This isn't going to be an actual overall review of Panty and Stocking as much as a talking point on something about it that I came out with very mixed feelings about which is, for the lack of a better way to call it, the meta aspect of this show.
First to give some structure to this, because if not I'm going to be all over the place, Panty and Stocking is a show that iterates between one of either 3 states: one of them is being very, very provocative either by being sexually charged, vulgar or just really nasty, the second state is when it'sbeing action packed, energetic, striking and a blast to watch and the last state it's when the show feels like it's just straight up trolling and laughing at its audience. That last part is mainly what I kind of mean by the "meta" aspect of it because this show demonstrates plenty of times that it can be exactly what the audience came for: a very provocative, over the top, action packed show with super striking visuals and an amazig soundtrack that pays plenty of homage to western cartoons and western media in general, and it feels like the creators know this and decided to sometimes tear it all apart in front of the audience for a while just to laugh at them for thinking that they're going to get what they want. A lot of people may think that I'm reading too much into it and that the "trolling" parts are the show trying to be funny or provocative in some way but failing spectacularly, being an overall hit or miss, and don't get me wrong I do think there are many moments in which the show is pretty hit or miss but there are many others like the mucus episode or the overly simplified flash-like animation of the beach episode (which Gainax normally uses for comedic effect as it clashes with the better looking scenes but here just felt incredibly pointless) or the first 80% of episode 10 which are moments that feel like the creators are knowingly trolling the audience, precisely in episode 10 after all of what felt like a completely inconsequential waste of time the show just so happens to end with one of the best moments of the entire series with the anarchy sisters song as to, again, remind us that it is completely capable of being great. (also, this is 2010 Gainax with none other than Hiroyuki Imaishi directing it, I could hardly think of a better staff capable of making a high quality show). Lastly, for one of the more indirect examples is Stocking's dating episode, looking at both Panty and Stocking it's not too hard to imagine that Stocking was going to be the fan favourite girl as she's a clear reference to all the "goth girl" archetype characters in western cartoons with the typical stand-offish action girl attitude so on the dating episode it's revealed that she has a huge genuine crush for really nasty, bad-mannered fat men without even really diving into why because the whole point of it was to crack her image and once again troll it's audience (to be honest that was one of the few moments in which I liked the trolling because I found it hilarious).\n\n
My whole point with this is that even if I think most of those moments were not good or enjoyable (because not being good was pretty much what they were designed to be) I have to admit I respect what Gainax went for, you know you have to get to someone's level when they are able to so effortlesly make something which could've been genuinely amazing that they just decide to every once in a while tear it apart just for the hell of it because who cares, I'm just kind of disappointed they chickened out and decided to actually give it a good proper ending instead of taking a metaphorical bat and breaking the whole show down like I was expecting them to do.

When I first went to watch this anime, the only review I read of it called it "an R-rated version of Power-Puff Girls." This is still the most succinct and accurate description of this show, but I'll try to add a bit more detail to that fantastic synopsis.
The premise is almost exactly like Power-Puff Girls - a group of girls (albeit 2 instead of the 3 in PPG) under the direction of a teacher fight evil ghosts in mini episodes, and typically there are 2 "episodes" in a 24 minute segment. The animation, style, and story are very similar to the American version, and itclearly takes a lot of inspiration from American cartoons. The big difference is in the R rating, and boy does this show enjoy riding that R rating to its limit. Even though I'm a seasoned anime viewer, there were still moments in this anime that were almost too much for me to handle - from an episode of tissue paper ghosts that prevent men from wiping themselves after ejaculating, endless sexual jokes that go to the extreme, and any obscene material you can think of. Panty and Stocking relishes in offensive material, but if you're able to handle some crude and disgusting jokes, it pulls it off pretty well.


The two main characters are Panty - a girl constantly having sex who uses her panties as a weapon - and Stocking, a girl who uses her stockings as a weapon and is addicted to sweets. The two have a contentious relationship and are held (somewhat) in check by their handler, Garterbelt, who does his best to keep the girls focused on their missions but often loses his temper. This makes for a hilarious dynamic between the characters, and it is very amusing to watch as various missions get derailed by Panty's horny nature or Stocking's insatiable need for sweets. The voices are perfect for the characters as well, Panty being the classic "bad girl" anime voice with Stocking having  the "smart/aloof" stereotype.


The animation is almost exactly like a PowerPuff Girls remake, so while I can't give it points for originality it does a great imitation and I like that style so no complaints there.


Overall this is a fun, hilarious show that I really enjoyed, and other than a few weird episodes that maybe went a bit too far - one episode about a beaten down corporate worker that seemingly had little to do with the rest of the show and was strangely dark kind of threw me off - most of the show was light, entertaining, and hilariously raunchy. Would definitely reccomend for fans of American cartoons or raunchy humor. 8/10

This show was terribad. its just gainax screwing around with all the money they made off of FLCL and Neon Genesis. and just cuz its gainax doesnt mean its good, they know you guys wil watch it just cuz its made by them

Ok, so maybe this is a little (rather very) unfair to write this review after only 1 episode, but I feel so strongly about it already I just have to say it.
I have to be honest--what first attracted me to this anime was the name. It just sounded so outlandish and my curiosity got the better of me! Within the first couple seconds I had my opinion--this is a disgustingly crude version of the Powerpuff Girls! But what else would you expect from the name? But still, I was giggling! So I paused the episode and went to look it up here on MAL, andthe reviews were surprisingly good. I thought, well, what do I have to lose except 30 minutes? Might as well finish the episode, since I was kinda giggling anyway...So I did. :)


This series is HIGHLY reminiscent of Powerpuff Girls in both premise and style (one of my very fave shows when I was younger), and so maybe this was a big appeal for me...But everything from the introduction to each episode to the awkward pauses and fast paced humour reminded me of PPG! Of course, wiiiiiiiith a dash of Spongebob Squarepants-esque humour (and random live action scenes), Ren & Stimpy crudeness (which I was never a fan of, and which I'm still not really a fan of in this show but I digress), with a pinch of Drawn Together shock humour, all with Japanese comic flare!


The art is done amazingly well--while I can't say I'm a huge fan of all of the character designs (the dog thing grosses me out), the animation is very clear and fluid. I haven't noticed the sound much yet, but their "angels fly away" song or something when they transform sounded pretty good. 


Overall, this anime was surprisingly enjoyable to watch. It was almost like I wasn't watching an anime at all with the Western style and humour, but subtle hints did remind me. I definitely found myself laughing when I expected to not like the series AT ALL when I first saw it. I give it an overall rating of 8 for its sheer enjoyable-ness! But I also take away points for the crudeness I don't really find appealing.

Well, when I first heard that Gainax was creating an anime with a lot of american-style animation, and with an absurd title that included the words “Panty and stocking”, I literally had no idea what to expect. However, considering how almost all anime nowadays seems to be playing things safe (moe, fanservice stuff that sells and makes money), Panty and Stocking turned out to be a refreshing experiment to see in action.
Admittingly, this show definitely is not for everybody; there is plenty of blatant sex, ghosts based on fecal matter or semen, panties and stockings raining down from the sky. Yea, this show is verydaring with it’s content, has a ton of fanservice, and is quite innuendo heavy. Even so, I’m more surprised with the fact that Gainax actually went ahead and made a show like this (which, at times, was actually almost stopped from being aired), and it turning out rather good.


This anime was definitely a huge experiment, breaking plenty of stereotypes and implementing some pretty absurd (yet new) ideas. It’s clearly visible that there is a lot of influence from American cartoons, prevalent in both the art style and the story format in each episode. There really wasn’t much of an overarching plot for this show (well, except for the last few episodes), but each episode served to parody a ton of different pop culture references. We got a Transformers parody, an Invader Zim homage, and a lot more random parodies and references. Not to mention, the soundtrack for this series was pretty darn good, with quite a few great pieces throughout the show.


I’ll admit that a good amount of the parody episodes were just for some cheap laughs, but there were a few rare gems amidst everything, such as Stocking’s romance episode as well as the final arc involving Panty and Brief. That being said, the main characters (Panty and Stocking) were a little one-dimensional and one sided, with not much variety in their actions and mannerisms.


Even so, they were a rather charming duo to watch, especially during the episodes in which their characters really do shine. The main problem here was that there was very little changes in the actual characters, which meant that the only pillar of support for the story was the sheer level of energy, as well as odd plot twists, that kept the show going.


Some of the animation in this show was excellent, with a great visual direction during certain key scenes. The battle scenes were especially something to look forward to, with some amazing over the top battles throughout the series. All in all, this show has created it’s own little niche in a sense, though it did also lack direction with it’s one-dimensional characters. This show definitely could have used some improvements (such as a more coherent overall plot, perhaps), but in the end Panty and Stocking turned out to be a surprisingly solid show, and most important of all, it was rather charming and fun to watch.


Production Quality: 9.0/10


Characters: 8.0/10


Story: 7.5/10


Setting: 7.5/10


Overall Enjoyment: 8.0/10



Feedback and comments (as well as criticisms) are always welcome :)

One of the most admirable things about this show as a whole, to me, is its refusal to take anything seriously. The characters, the situations they find themselves in, the script, down to the very plot - everything is chopped, screwed, and stretched to the extreme. If you're looking for something serious, or with a basic level of consistency, you should look elsewhere.
And yet, because of its fast-and-loose approach, it's managed to pull a fiercely loyal fanbase and maintained its place among the pantheon of in/famous shows since its release. It's incredibly crude, very silly to the point of being obnoxious, and features characters whohave continued to exist beyond the show. It's often cute, pretty funny, and features strong female characters. I didn't walk away from this with any major investment in it, nor am I one of the many left pining for a second season, but I do think there's something more interesting than the basic gross-out humor and ridiculousness of the show, and that something might be worth your attention for 13 episodes.


The first part of that something is its playfulness. My introduction to the show was as an extremely crude take on the Powerpuff Girls, where cute, benevolent heroes are replaced by selfish, stupid angels who defeat evil incidentally or only after being prodded enough. Many people will pant over their 'sexy' transformation scenes, but no sooner will you see them naked than they will be submerged in literal waves of shit, piss and vomit. Sexuality isn't sexy here - it's cheap, silly, and over-the-top, tempting fanboys looking for naked chicks while offering an ironic or humorous edge that gives it more substance.


Their selfishness, their hard individualism, makes Panty and Stocking stand out as characters - Panty may often wield her sexuality like her eponymous weapon, but the show makes it clear she's her own person no matter how many men she hooks up with. While Stocking is the more responsible of the two, she's hardly self-sacrificing and would rather be eating sweets than saving the world. They may not be nice, but their antisocial behavior has what I'd call a subversive sheen to it, something that rebels against what we're supposed to be, regardless or perhaps because of how stupid an nonsensical it all is.


I will point out that, despite these interesting elements, this show receives a rather modest 7 from me. There are some episodes that dragged, or humor that missed the mark. The ghost of a metaplot regarding the two demon sisters was light on content while also managing to take up space that could have been used other ways. I'm more than happy to go with plot elements that seem confusing or contradictory, but there are a few times when I think it hurt how the episodes played out. Outside of Panty and Stocking the characters are pretty bland. The soundtrack was pretty good outside of a few acerbic pieces (Fly Away will be forever scratched into my memory), and the English voice-acting was flat and uninteresting - my suggestion would be to stick with the Japanese original.

"Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt: An Exercise in Just Being Fun"
While I usually reserve the 8-9-10 tier of movies and TV for strictly intelligent and clever productions, I recently watched a show that was so well executed and so enjoyable that it practically left me no choice but to rethink my grading scale. 
That show was none other than Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt, a fun little answer to the Powerpuff Girls released back in 2010 by Gainax. Panty and Stocking takes the Saturday morning cartoon approach of being episodic in nature and not having a continually flowing narrative. The big difference between Panty andStocking and your average kid's cartoon show though, is massive, and it's what sets it apart from the rest of the fodder.


Panty and Stocking is raunchy and vulgar as fuck. It doesn't give a shit about being smart or being emotional; this show just wants to have a great time and take anyone bold enough to join it on one hell of a ride. This is also an anime that personally I prefer the dubbed version over the subtitled. Reason being is that the voice acting in the American version is so shamelessly over the top that I can't get enough of it. It's fucking wonderful and fun, just as it should be. I understand that people really like the "RURURURU" thing from the subtitled version, but honestly I just prefer it dubbed. Personal preferences, I suppose. 


Another aspect of Panty and Stocking that sticks out is its visual appeal. The art style on display here is far more Americanized than your average anime, if you will. Action is fast-paced, violent, and loose, and the overall structure of the world and characters is lined with sharper edges and borders than you're used to. What I mean by that is that it abandons any notion of a realistic art style and puts all its chips on "cartoony as fuck" and again, I feel this was the perfect approach for this production. 


The characters and story aren't really the stronger areas, but I'll brush over them briefly. Panty is a slut and Stocking loves chocolate. Garterbelt has a fetish I can't even talk about on this site, and Brief is a nerdy and awkward kid hiding a huge secret underneath those messy bangs of his. Those are the only characters that really matter, so there. I'm ignoring Scanty and Kneestocks here mostly because I can't really describe them as having significant personalities; they feel more like accessories to the plot. 


As for the story, it isn't really all that interesting. The angels (Panty and Stocking) have to collect 100 coins or something to get back into heaven. It's more of a token plot to move characters and production along, so don't think as though I'm ignoring it because I find it boring. No, the overall plot just doesn't matter. It's rarely brought up and is pretty much swept under the rug for most of the episodes. While I do feel that this was probably the right approach, I still think it could have been done better. Really though, I'm pleased with what I got and I can't complain too much about the story.


Now where this anime truly shines is the music. Holy fucking shit, the soundtrack is amazing. Nearly every song will make you want to dance, and I can easily say the entire soundtrack is worth buying. It's that damn good. Both the opening and closing songs are amazing, and the angel transformation song, "Fly Away Now", is so much fun that it practically steals the show every time it's placed in the show. All in all, a fantastic soundtrack that perfectly fits this show. 


Overall, I loved Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt. It's fun, raunchy, aggressive, unique, creative, and a breath of fresh air. If I'm being completely honest here, P&S is actually my favorite of the golden age Gainax productions (TTGL, NGE, P&S, and FLCL being the cream of the crop here). Watch Panty and Stocking if you want to see what it's like when a production focuses on and succeeds at just being fun and enjoyable.


Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt earns an 8/10.

SPOILERS ARE IN THIS REVIEW. IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO READ ANY SPOILERS FOR THIS ANIME, PLEASE DO NOT READ ANY FURTHER!!
(I also compare Panty and Stocking to a few western cartoons, because the creators got a lot of influence from western animation and culture. It only made sense to me to do so.)
Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt follow the adventures of two angels that have been sent to Earth for being jerks. Now, their only way back is to earn "heaven coins", once they earn enough, they can make it back through the pearly gates.
Panty, a sex-crazed rebel, and Stocking, a sugar lovinggoth, have to earn these heaven coins by taking out demons in a "demon-of-the-week" fashion, with the help of Brief, a geeky klutz, and Garterbelt, a very…very weird priest with a mysterious past. Along the way, they encounter demonic sisters, and a man named Corset, the mayor of the town, and they plan on ridding the world of Panty and Stocking and taking over the world.




It is a simple premise, but man does the show do a lot with it!




Let’s discuss why Panty and Stocking is so great.


 While it doesn't always seem the most appealing, I feel Panty and Stocking isn't trying to be the best-looking anime out there. It is trying to parody what is commonly expected in the animation department for anime, which can lead to the show flipping between animation genres frequently. Panty and Stocking can jump into flash, live action, hand drawn, CGI, and all of these things can literally be in the span of a few seconds. It is quite impressive! 


Panty and Stocking parody popular anime, movies, western animation and culture in general...like, Transformers, Phoenix Wright, They "briefly" mention Indiana Jones, Dirty Harry, Ghostbusters, The Powerpuff Girls, South Park, Ren and Stimpy, Barbie Dolls, Sex and the City, Death Race 2000, Dawn of the Dead, Star Wars...So. Many. Things. Some of it is very sneakily put in as well, which can really catch the viewer off guard. 

While the show's gross out humor, and overuse of sexual jokes can be a turn off to some, I think the very idea of gross out humor is put on full display here. Something gross in, say, Spongebob, is an episode like the Splinter…In Sanjay and Craig, giving birth to a fart, or Stimpy from Adult Party cartoon having one poop joke be the entire premise behind an episode...


While these shows do not portray this kind of gross out through the entire run, except for Adult Party Cartoon, they still show the wrong way to do gross-out humor, in my opinion. Gross-out humor should over-exaggerate the grossness of a scenario to make it funny; the situations in the episodes I brought up however simply do nothing with the fact that something gross is happening on screen, they each take the situations and play them realistically. Which is boring.

 Panty and Stocking, however, goes WAY over the top with its gross out humor, making a lot of it work. Also, when something gross is on screen, it is never there for too long. Say for instance, the episode "The Runny" which is all about...picking boogers!


Because of course it is. Just bear with me for a sec.


Panty and Stocking are invited onto the blimp of a man named "Oscar H. Genius", voiced by none other than Vic Mignogna.


Panty and he form an unusual bond...but, Panty soon finds out Oscar is a demon named Ugly Snot, trying to get everyone to fetishize picking their nose, which will inevitably blast them off to the moon using the knock back power of their own nosebleeds.

Is the plot gross? Yes, but nothing shown on screen is that disgusting, and everything moves by so fast, with a barrage of jokes and character interactions, I didn't seem to mind. Plus, the scenario is so far out of the realm of plausibility, you can look past the gross stuff, and laugh at how far the entire thing is going. 

For a better look into why I believe Panty and Stocking’s gross out works, let’s look into another episode!


"Vomiting Point", is a gross episode toward the end, but it has such an amazing story from the start, you get easily sucked into what is going on. Let me run it by you really quick, so you can see it from my point of view.


In this episode, the main character is an older man named Terao, and he is having a rough life; both at work and at home. At work, Terao is hassled by his boss, and at home things seem mundane and unexciting. This is all played realistically, even down to the art style. 

While Terao is at home, his young daughter asks for an autograph from "Panty and Stocking" for her birthday the next day, and Terao finds out about who they are. Terao goes back to work, is hassled even more, and winds up having to drink an entire tower of beer, which leads him to vomit, and a ghost that had been possessing him takes over that puke and starts terrorizing the city. 

Panty and Stocking show up near Terao to defeat this ghost, and he tries talking them into coming to his house to see his daughter. Panty and Stocking decline, weirded out by the old man, but decide to give him an autograph for the heck of it. Terao's daughter receives this from him, and the end has Terao, again, begin hassled by his boss. It is hinted that Terao’s is respected a bit more, but it is only something I can assume; not something I am entirely sure of because of where the episode leaves off.


Now, why would I like this episode since I said earlier that I do not like gross out being portrayed realistically? Well, towards the end of this episode the entire scenario is played up for its absurdity; where this episode passes the others, like Spongebob’s the splinter and Adult Party Cartoon, is how it is set-up. Where Adult Party Cartoon and Spongebob started on the same level of gross and weird throughout, and threw in a slight bit of realism, Vomiting Point was realistic until the situation comes to a head, and the gross out becomes absurd. Also, the “vomit” sequences aren’t on the screen too long, and aren’t really that gross to begin with. 

How does this episode justify the gross scenarios then? Well…

It is such a sad episode, and really does throw you off the first time seeing it. I think Vomiting Point is more of a play on realism vs. escapism, and how real life is tough; sometimes, the best you can do is grin and bear it...the cartoons that you love will never be around long enough to save you from how tough life can be, and you should celebrate your tiniest victories no matter what they are. Remember what you are living for, put those you love first. At least that is what I thought.

 It is visually interesting, and really thought provoking. All of that from an episode with a pretty gross premise. If you aren’t a fan of gross out humor, I still strongly suggest you give Panty and Stocking a try. It does a lot with its look, and there is more to it than what might appear on the outside.


Story wise, Panty and Stocking does have a story; to stop the demon sisters from taking over the world, which progressively becomes a bigger threat as the series continues, and to bust the weekly ghost. It is a little more to it than that later in the series, but that is pretty much it. Unlike most anime that follows a story, Panty and Stocking is mostly episodic; they can die one episode, be brought back, and die again the next episode. The story's, while not the most amazing stories ever told, are funny, fast-paced, silly, and really feel like you are stepping into the lives of these goofball characters. The story does pick up a bit more and become more important as the first season continues, but for the most part the series does remain episodic.


Speaking of the characters, a lot of the people in Panty and Stocking are really wacky, colorful, weird, incredibly disturbing, and I love every bit of it. Please trust me when I say this show has incredibly endearing, likable, and charming characters, despite the gross and weird nature of the episodes these characters get stuck in. While Panty and Stocking are rather mean, they still hold a very charming and enjoyable presence with them.  My favorite characters are probably "The Demon Sisters", though Scanty and Kneesocks. They make for an excellent foil for Panty and Stocking; Where Panty and Stocking are gross, nasty, foul mouthed angel's, Kneesocks and Scanty are respectable, rule following, demons who love morals. Scanty and Kneesocks, are the hero's you want, but you are left with Panty and Stocking; these rude, jerks...it is clever, and adds for a nice change of pace from regular shows, where the hero is typically nice and respectable, and the major villains typically aren't. Some may find Panty and Stocking’s jerkishness to be a bit jarring, but these characters do get there commupins for being so horrible; and as the series progresses, you do see changes in the characters. Panty and Stocking learn to appreciate Brief and Garterbelt better in a very subtle and charming manner. You also learn why these character’s act the way they do, and you’re even presented with a sweeter side of each of them. Like, for Stocking in ‘Ghost; The Phantom of Datencity” and for Panty in ‘Panty and Brief’. Pretty much, what Panty and Stocking lack in story, they make up for in character; and they go well above the call of duty the show really loves that kind of humor too; any situation that Panty and Stocking can show their butts in, both literally and figuratively, they will do it and exaggerate it to a whole new level of weird. 


The over the top action...goodness...let me just say, this show has incredible action. When Panty and Stocking first meet Scanty and Kneesocks, the fight goes from underground in the sewers, to the bathroom, to driving up a building, two cars racing and tearing through the thin halls of a high school, to the roof of Datencity High. I can't do it justice, but know these episodes are eleven minutes long and all of this was put into that short span of time. Kudos, writers! This action is entertaining, quick, and filled with different animation types and one-liners. It's great, and adds for some tense, weird action. Trust me when I say weird. One action scene involves Panty’s weapon of choice getting stuck to the face of a ghost disguised as a vehicle; and the action with this scene lasts the entire length for the episode, besides the opening sequence. And that is the second episode of the show!



The last point I am going to be making here is about the end of series. So, if you don’t want a major spoiler, just know…SPOILERS ARE AHEAD... AGAIN.


So, toward the end of the series after Corset has been defeated and Stocking returns from heaven…well…Stocking just kills Panty. In a very brutal, over the top fashion; she dices her in cubes, says she is a ghost and runs away with Corset (who is like…a jellybean thing?) to try to take over the world elsewhere. 

A lot of people seem to really hate this because of how quickly the event happened, but I didn’t have that much of a problem with it. 

Why? A few reasons. For one, this felt more like a parody on how some shows will leave you dangling on this massive cliffhanger without any response at all. Judging by the other character’s interactions about this, I can only see this being that; a parody. The violence was so over the top and foolish too, of course it will catch you off guard, but that is the joke. Plus, Panty and Stocking have died in previous episodes, or have found themselves on the rough end of a situation, for only the episode to end like that. It is meant to be exaggerated and played for laughs.


If that excuse doesn’t work for you, there is an episode that kind of foreshadowed these events, “Ghost; the Phantom of Datencity” a season two? Stocking falls in love with a ghost that all the humans, and angels find disgusting. Something that apparently isn’t too common. COINCIDENCE? I THINK NOT!


Interesting enough, there are hints floating around that Panty and Stocking might get a second season, though, this has not been fully confirmed yet by Studio Gainax, but just now that there is a HIGH..HIGH possibility that a second season is underway. And the creators enjoy the idea of sticking with Stocking being a demon, Scanty keeping her sex-juice-induced scar on her face…. Lots of that can be found in the wiki article linked below.


[SEASON TWO OF PANTY AND STOCKING INFO|http://psg.wikia.com/wiki/User_blog:Bütterfly/The_OVA_and_Season_2


If that wiki article isn’t enough for you, how about the actual Japanese voices for for Panty and Stocking discussing season 2 as their characters?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R-5ZN-ed8AA


Let’s just say, I wouldn’t worry about the ending too much for any longer.



I love this series, and I proudly say it is my favorite anime of all time. It is fun, and even if it is a bit crass and vulgar, I think it is an anime that everyone should check out. It is something different, and dares to stand out. There is a sea of anime that I sometimes have trouble telling apart from other anime. But, Panty and Stocking will always be something I can recognize; both because of the art style and the dialogue. It came at a time when I needed to laugh the most, and it did that with spades.


With that underway, thank you all for reading this! Have a good day.

VERY MINOR SPOILER ALERT
Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt is a western adult cartoon inspired series about two fallen angels; sisters Panty and Stocking Anarchy. They must hunt and destroy ghosts on Earth to earn their way back into Heaven with the help of their caretaker (of sorts), Garterbelt, and their dog, Chuck. This series pushes the limit on just about every topic it can. The series is crude, explicit to the extreme, borderline pornographic... and it's glorious. The Anarchy sisters have certainly earned their surname. I fell in love with all the main characters instantly, and I enjoyed seeing the ridiculous (and gross) ghosts theyhad to face. 


I feel as though they could've introduced Scanty and Kneesocks sooner, because until they came around, all conflicts with ghosts seemed completely random, but perhaps that give the series a bit more element of surprise.


After episode six, there is a bit too much filler for my tastes. Much of it wasn't even enjoyable filler. It felt as though the creators were attempting to make the viewers as confused and/or grossed-out as much as they possibly could before an intense final 2-3 episodes. 


I was immensely satisfied with the final episode right up until the final minute or so, where a shocking (and nonsensical, if you ask me) end awaits you, should you watch past the closing song. Supposedly, it is a playful nudge at studio Gainax endings, but I personally was very upset.


The art style for 90% of the series is initially... disgusting. There are a few shots throughout the series of gorgeous animation, 


but it's not nearly enough to save you from the pure cringe of the main art style. That said, it actually fits the entire series very well, and the art style will become more and more charming as you bond with the characters.


Overall, the main points preventing it from being one of my favorites is the extreme amount of gross-out scenes, the dragging bits of filler, and the ending. Regardless, I still enjoyed the series as a whole, and I haven't lost any love for the characters or atmosphere of the series.

to be fair this is just a really well done fun show, there is literally nothing too much to it, it is pure entertainment with an awesome soundtrack backing it up, the animation is on point and done with so many little fun touches in pacing and rhythm it just works, id never take a show like this as offensive because it does its best at being hilarious and comedic smart and it nails it pretty hard
there are some episodes that of course run by slower or provide with content that doesn't reach your expectations after being mind blown by some of the previous scenes,but most of the episodes just offer such good content its hard to believe one wouldn't enjoy most of it\n\n
it  quickly became one of my all time favorites and easily one of my top 10s

Let me just start by saying that this is one of the funniest animes I have ever watched, though the humor is right up my ally, it might not be for everyone. I made my review in video format. Here it is. Subscribe to my youtube channel and follow me on twitter.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEu7pC_sdLY
But I guess I have to make this review longer to be able to post it, so here we go - in short - I really enjoyed Panty and Stocking. It's a great parody of American culture through the eyes of a Japanese person. It's a must watch to any American, but as a European I still enjoyed it. I'm going to start this review off with a precursor: Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt is a show that originally came out when I was 14. A lot of my friends at the time really enjoyed it, however, I never watched it because I was a dumb kid who couldn't figure out how to.
Now, as an adult, I often go into the entertainment trade store and check the World Cinema section, which as you can imagine, has anime. I saw the DVD and decided to pick it up, and finally give this anime a go.
As you can tell by my score, it wasn't to mytaste.


First things first, I want to address a point. Whenever someone dislikes this anime, the thing that's often brought up is "Is it because of it's similarities to Western cartoons or its art style?" It's neither. I actually thought the art was stylish, fun and quirky. Same can be said about the music, albeit I wouldn't listen to it outside of this anime because most of it is arguably not very good. It did fit in with the vibe of the anime though, and I can definitely give it props for that.


The thing that I didn't enjoy about it was the humor. I was expecting a show that satirised Western cartoons, but rather what I got was the exact same lowbrow humor that can be found in Western primetime cartoons. I'm not saying I went into Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt expecting anything intellectually stimulating, but rather, I expected something executed with a bit more finesse, and focus on parody rather than reinforcing the same tropes that I feel it was trying to mock.


I'm fine with crude humour. I enjoyed Space Dandy. I'm fine with sex jokes. I found B-gata H-kei endearing and funny and it essentially relied on them. So what's my issue with Panty & Stocking?


It's simple: The humor is far too obtuse to a point where it's not funny or relatable, and at times, is flat out unwatchable. Many of the jokes just left me wincing, and others were so disgusting they were difficult to stomach. For many of the jokes, the punchline was simply how vulgar or ridiculous the scenario or dialogue of the titular characters is. It's shock based humor, which after being on the internet for 8 years, and frankly, growing into a mature adult, does nothing for me.


Panty & Stocking was at its best in episodes that didn't rely on toilet humor as its one and only gag, but they were so few and far between that they were essentially non-existent. 


All in all, I think I was too late for the trend, and 14 year old me would've found this show funnier and more enjoyable than 21 year old me.

Hello ladies and gentlemen of the internet, my name is Luis and today I’ll be reviewing Japan’s racist yet somehow accurate view of America better known as “Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt”.
There's a video version of the review in the link below if you don't feel like reading
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GCIG1fBmNAQ)
Panty & Stocking are two fallen angels that are forced to buy their way back into heaven due to their sinful nature. In other words Panty is a gigantic whore that will fuck anything that has a dick and Stocking is a would-be lardass due to all of the sweets she consumes on a daily basis, except thatand I quote: “all of her weight goes to her boobs”. Well that pretty much concluded every will I had of cursing for the rest of the video. Oh that’s another thing, the characters of this anime curse as easily as you breathe keep that in mind.\n\n
Characters & Synopsis:\n
Outside of the aforementioned Panty & Stocking, the series also has Garterbelt a stereotypical black catholic priest that likes little boys, a wannabe dog named Chuck that looks like Gir from Invader Zim, Briefers a weakling nerd that is in love with Panty but only ends up as the sex toy of Garterbelt most of the time, and finally the Demon sisters Scanty and Kneesocks which only live to try to be better than Panty and Stocking but failing every single time. With that said, the premise of the show is as stated before with a monster of the week kind of thing in the early episodes and a little story arc towards the end.\n\n
Animation & Soundtrack:\n
Studio Gainax is famous for always experimenting around with their works and this anime was no exception as Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt is the most Americanized anime of all times, to the point that if it was aired on Comedy Central along with South Park nobody would know that this is an anime. With that said, the animation fits the show down to a tea as the show is nothing more than a satire of everything American, or ‘Murica to those overly proud of the motherland.\n
As with the animation, the soundtrack for Panty & Stocking is nothing special anywhere outside of the show itself but it fits it very well. A special notice should be made to the song performed in episode 10 titled “D City Rock” by TeddyLoid and Debra Zeer, outside of the song being extremely catchy and perverted just like the rest of the series, it is a gigantic homage to a huge numbers of artists and rock bands like Def Leppard, Nirvana, Queen, KISS, Lady Gaga, Jimmy Hendrix and others.\n
As for whether this anime is better subbed or dubbed it really comes down to your own taste but the dubbed is done in such a wonderfully fitting way that I find it hard to believe anyone that would choose the subbed version.\n\n
Final Scores:\n
As for final ratings I give Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt a Critical Score of 7.3 out of 10, a Personal Enjoyment Score of 8.5 out of 10 and a Rewatch Value of 4.0 out of 5.\n
For alternate animes recommendations I suggest the other Gainax What The Fuck Am I Watching work known as FLCL as both shows simply make want to say What The Fuck at least once in every episode and both have over-the-top characters that would never fit into the fabric of reality.

It's really hard to rate this anime because it really is between horrible and incredibly good.
And this is a fact for every aspect that you can rate :
-Story :For the first 6 episodes, nothing happens, the stories are not related to each other and if you skipped episode 2,3,4,5,6 you wouldn't even notice it. But after the introduction of (minor spoiler ahead) the demon sisters who are reversed mirror images of Panty and Stocking the story begins to have some real interesting twists, but it still isn't a great story that will change your world.
But let's be honest, you do not watch this anime forthe story, I actually don't know why you would watch this anime, I still don't know why I watched it. Because this anime is just full of sex and other dirty jokes, in a weird way this anime is more perverted than a hentai, you don't see anything that would be NSFW, but what is said is so much more intense. It can be funny to some people (including myself) but sometimes it is just so ridiculous that I almost dropped the episode. For example : (I'm about the story of 2 episodes but this can hardly be counted as a spoiler) 

In the very first episode the enemy is a ghost who is eating people by sucking them into the toilets, this is one of the worst enemies in this anime but in another one P&S are fighting dead fapping soldiers' ghosts who are destroying tissues because they couldn't fap anymore or some weird ridiculous sh*t like that. These weren't even funny anymore, they were just ridiculous (and I mean this in a bad way), but overall somehow this anime is entertaining enough to keep you from dropping it.


-Art : I think I never saw that much different art styles in a single anime ! The usual style used is an art resembling american cartoons and I actually thought that P&S was a weird anime made by an american studio (even though I watched it in japanese). This is only my opinion, buy it took me sometime to accept this style, I really found it ugly and not at all pleasing to watch, but after some episodes I got used to it. But then there are other art styles that you can divide in 2 categories :

The reference/serious art style which is used for secondary characters to make a reference to another anime or game or comic etc or to give an ambiance to the scene that will make it look more serious than the usual (which is really hard considering that the perverted and dirty jokes are still there)

The attractive art style which is used for Panty, Stocking and the 2 demons. Once again I will be revealing some stuff about the anime but you learn this in the first episode so it still isn't a real spoiler. So that being said Panty is called so because the uses her panties to make a weapon and Stocking is called so because she uses her stockings to make a weapon. So almost every time they use their "weapons" we get to watch a couple of seconds of how they transform themselves in an art style where they actually look hot and attractive and which is more like the usual way anime characters are represented. 

This mashup of styles is a bit weird some times but isn't disturbing and adds a bit of atmosphere to the anime


Sound : I actually don't care that much about sound in animes and especially in this one, the voices are good (at least in japanese) except the one of Garterbelt who for some reason annoys me every time he speaks. The opening is short and the music is not really remarkable but the music when P&S are transforming is actually pretty catchy


Character : There aren't many main characters in this anime so let's make this quick.

Panty is a sex addict, and it also took me some time to find her interesting because in the first episode that's all what is shown about her : rude and craving for sex at any moment. But while she still is always looking for sex, she gets a bit more of character especially in her fights with her sister which makes her look a bit more interesting

Stocking is a sugar addict and is actually one of the main reasons for why I watched this show. She is kind of cute thanks to her voice and how she is behaving when she can eat, and she achieves to be funny and not in some perverted way. Her reactions to situations are maybe what makes her the most interesting ; she stays cold and still in many situations but totally freaks out when she can't get her pudding or cake.

Garterbelt is playing the role of the father of P&S but I don't know why he annoys me, his voice is unpleasing and he doesn't bring much, he's just the one giving the missions and is also the "useful plot twister" if I can say so

There are other characters but I won't reveal them, but to say a quick word about them, they get interesting personalities and if they will not surprise you, they are entertaining and funny enough


Enjoyment + Overall: Well as long as Garterbelt is not talking and the monsters are not completely ridiculous. It is the weirdest yet one of the funniest animes I ever watched. I had a very good time watching this anime, I also had many WTF moments where I really didn't really understand what was happening and most importantly why it was happening but it still was funny. This anime is rude filled with perversion and foul elements but it amazing how the most random elements put together made such an incredible anime thus making it an outstanding masterpiece to me.

If South Park had to be produced by Gainax, this would be the result.
This FLCL-like show had me skeptical, as the old saying goes: "Never judge a book by its cover." 
I must confess, the soundtrack (rave/club songs for the most part, but GOOD, colorful, music nonetheless, I cannot get enough it now, and I'm an avowed metal fan.) was what got me motivated, not so much interested, to give the show a shot. Midway through the first episode, I was convinced this was not a run-of-the-mill show. It breaks all walls, rules, and I became hooked. 
The story is something I don't think anyperson can make up off the top of their head: two protagonists, Panty and Stocking, are angels sent by Heaven, turning panties into guns and stockings into swords and fighting evil. Their "boss" is a black priest with an afro named Garterbelt who has a penchant for young boys and sexual fetishes. Every character is named after an undergarment of some sort. 


And yes, I really wish I was making this up.


The art and animation speak for themselves; VERY stylized and diverse, through and through. I don't think I've seen any other show implement the approach seen in the show.


This is a well-executed, incredibly fun show that does not take itself seriously at all and really pushes the envelope in terms of sexual innuendo. The more you watch in shock, the less you even notice it anymore. It becomes all the more normal; an interesting phenomenon. 


If you want a wild and crazy comedic anime that knows no rules, you've found it.

Panty and Stocking is not your usual anime. I know many of you have read this before but it is true. The characters, the artwork-everything about it manages to stand out from most animes. 
Story: 7
Pretty much, Panty and Stocking are fallen angels who are kicked out of heaven for being bitches and to get back they must kill all of the ghosts haunting Daten City. These ghosts are not your usual floating bed sheets. These ghosts are composed of actual crap, throw up, and one even has breasts that squirt some sort of cream. If you don't have a strong stomach, I wouldn't recommendwatching this series. Aside from the ghost hunting, Panty and Stocking tend to get themselves in pretty silly situations. One whole episode is dedicated to them sitting in their living room, complaining about their hunger, and having random conversations. That's all there is and it still managed to be one of my favorite episodes.


Art: 9


If you've seen the main image for this anime, you would know that the characters aren't the slightest bit close to the usual anime style. Panty and Stocking are short with thick legs, exaggerated hair, huge hands, and not all that curvacious bodies. Even though it doesn't follow the usual "kawaii-desu" style most animes try to pull off, it's beautifully drawn and it's not like Panty and Stocking are unappealing to look at. Then we have the girl's transformation scenes when the girls are given revealing outfits to barely cover their suddenly tall, statuesque, and overall sexy forms. This style of art occurs rarely, almost playing as a cock tease for all the otakus and weeaboos who are displeased that these girls aren't always drawn this way. 


The scenery is also fairly cartoonish. Daten City is the slightest bit similar to Townsville with tall buildings and plenty of clouds. 


Sound: 9


Oh god, that soundtrack. Panty and Stocking surely isn't an anime filled with bubblegum pop themes. They scrap this for techno meets electronic meets dance music filled with literal sex moans. Yes, you heard me right. Try looking up "Pantscada" and having a drinking game over how many moans you here. No, better yet look up "Juice". 


The OST still has a few mellow songs. "Chocolat" is appropriately sweet and cute with some gracious French. "Fallen Angel" is definitely one of the best ending themes I've heard a long with a strangely cheery animation of Panty and Stocking being put through death traps while they bob their heads to the music.  What I love about the music is that not a single song is even in Japanese. Each one is fairly well spoken Engrish which may be a reference to how Panty and Stocking at times speak.  


Character: 7


Panty and Stocking would be nothing without it's outrageous characters. Panty is the oldest of the two and is a violent, underwear gun totting, nymphomaniac, who says "fuck" at least three times per episode. There's also Stocking who is a gothic lolita who adores sweets and has magical socks that turn into katanas. 

The supporting characters involve Gaterbelt (who appropriately wears a garter belt). He's a black, afro priest, who also happens to be a pedophile. Chuck is practically Gir on more drugs and Brief is the awkward, Panty obsessed loser. Then there's Scanty and Kneesocks who play as evil but more well mannered counterparts to the angel sisters. 


The characters are not meant to be looked up to as role models. All the characters are mainly composed of flaws and that's what keeps them interesting. What I love about Panty and Stocking is that they are practically mock the moe-moe-kawaii desu-oops my underwear's showing for the twentieth time-characters. They aren't meant to be super cute or moe and that's what makes them likeable. They aren't tsuderes or the overly clumsy girl, they're them. You can't label these girls under a specific stereotype. If you do, I would surely love to know how in the world it was possible.


The only downside to the characters is that they never develop. I guess this is supposed to be a part of it's comedy but it's a bit of a downer to see the characters start and finish the way they always were. 


Enjoyment: 9


Boy does this show entertain you. There's always a plethora of dirty joke after dirty joke for the viewers and the action is fairly generous and well animated. Unlike High School of The Dead or Rosario Vampire, Panty and Stocking doesn't need to give you handfuls of fanservice every five seconds to keep you watching. They use their crude sense of humor to carry on the plot. The jokes do get overwhelming though and I did at times wish for a joke that wasn't filled with innuendos and swears. 



Overall: 9


A great anime series for anybody looking for something fun, raunchy, and different to watch. If you want to find an anime filled with cute, fapable characters, with all the waifu material in the world, you're looking for the wrong show.

Panty and Stocking with Garterbelt had to be one of the most enjoyable, unique anime I have stumbled upon. However it is not for the easily disturbed conservative. To me it most resembles a more adult humored version of the Powerpuff Girls and the random scattered nature of Fooly Cooly. It pushes the boundaries towards hentai without any nudity or sex actually shown. The stories are short, two 10 minute chapters in each episode. Everyone one of them had me laughing at some point from the exaggerated reactions and ridiculous stories. Some moments had me awkwardly uncomfortable that I could watch such perverted humor andstill find it funny, but I even enjoyed those moments. The last episode left me hanging and I can't wait for another season (assuming what the cliffhanger it ended with was leading to another season)


The style is a unique comic book style, again that I can only relate to the Powerpuff Girls. It was simple, unlike the usual detailed style of anime, but was visually fun with hugely exaggerated shapes and lines creating detailed chaos as hectic crazy stories unfolded. The soundtrack had some killer tunes that made you want to dance and feel bad ass at the same time. The dubbing however, as usual, had chosen the most frustrating of voice actors, I recommend watching the subbed over the dubbed English. They rarely get English voice actors correct in my opinion when it comes to anime so I wasn't expecting anything here.


The characters were wonderfully constructed, Panty the badass slutty angel, Stocking the goth girl with an epic sweet tooth, Garter the black afro priest with a fetish for kink. Stocking's design had to be my favorite, just because I tend to like things on the darker side while I loved Panty's sass. Garter was humorous as a character that was everything he shouldn't be. 


If you're looking for a laugh, and can stand overly perverted humor, borderlining on taking it too far and becoming hentai then this anime will do ya just fine.

Art: The art is quite childish, almost reminding me of my childhood show, The Powerpuff Girls. Except, of course, that this anime is absolutely lewd. In a hilarious context! There are scenes here and there with the typical anime drawings, but otherwise, it's mostly drawn like a kid's anime.

First Impression & Bias:
So you look at the title and ask what is up with the undergarments? I will say that I find ecchi in bad taste, but if I was looking for something even worst I found it. Disgusting, morally insulting, and cartoonish art. To tell the truth I don't know why I picked this up. However, this show was able amaze me a few times, and its uniqueness for sure caught me for the ride.
Expectation: 4 Bad
Episode Scores: -,-,-,7,4,4,10,7,6,9,7,4,8,10
Actual: 7 (Good)
So the story has a slut, a sweet loving goth, a homosexual afro-priest, and the first episode has a giant monster composed ofhuman feces. While I was on the verge of vomiting through the first episode, I forced my way through and eventually saw the light. There is nothing truly redeeming about this show, but like taking a shot in the dark it started to find the target. Yes, this show is awesome because it is so bad. Is that possible? There is a point where my disgust boiled right back over into enjoyment; so awkward and horrible that I praised it and enjoyed it for it. Of course, there was plenty of times when it failed to cross the threshold. Yet, as it destroyed my brain more and more the show became better and better.\n
The introduction of the twins made this show a lot more bareable in the second half. After witnessing one of the best action scenes I have seen, a whole five minutes of non-stop fighting that matches this shows extreme nature, I was speechless. Yet, they kept reappearing offering a new better dynamic to the show.\n
This is a hard show to write for. I don't think there is much that can even compare to the elements of this plot, as it is unique. They touch upon as many subjects as they can: from Transformers to zombies. From losing weight to falling in love. From sperm fighting against tissues to  gambling. Oh there is also a music video in there too. This show is ludicrously random, and will leave you expecting what is coming next. It makes you disgusted, confused, and it almost even made me cry.\n\n
Conclusion: \n
This show has been the most sporadic of anything I have ever watched. Given me the biggest emotional reactions, a mix of love and hate fused into one show; just as all the others have taken up either one of those sides. While I am neutral there are plenty of people that will praise this as the best, and others the worst. So, which side will you pick dear reader? It is worth a test!\n

This review may contain foul language!
Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt, or simply PSG. From the very first minute this show strikes you with overwhelming craziness and vulgarity. It's a totally brainless, insane and bizarre comedy without even a single serious moment. The whole show is just one big parody of western animated series like South Park. It will make you giggle over dirty jokes, drop your jaw to over-the-top action scenes and admire its visual madness - well, unless you hate everything insane and lewd.
Let's take a closer look at the show.
Story
PSG is driven by action and humour, so the story doesn't really matter thatmuch here. It's absolutely worthless to look for logic or any common sense in what's happening - you'd better just turn your brains off and follow the bizarre adventures of Anarchy sisters, Panty and Stocking, the two main protagonists of the series. All episodes are full of adrenaline and high-paced action scenes that can easily blow your mind. Though the most of episodes follow the same template and are somewhat repetitive (sisters locate their enemies, fight and eventually defeat them), several eps completely break out of this scheme, like "We are Angels" which is more like a music video. Feels refreshing and inventive.

The humour in the show is represented mostly with lewd jokes about sex, shit, the list goes on (which are actually done excellently and make you laugh your ass off, if you're into that type of humour of course), but there's also a plenty of parodies and references to western culture (especially hollywood cinema and american TV), most of them are done nicely.


Art

Well, it wouldn't sound like exaggeration to state that PSG has one of the most unique visual styles that any anime ever had. It's very bright, contrast and reminiscent of western animation. At first it can seem pretty offbeat if compared to general anime style, and not very detailed, but it's not hard to get used to it since this kind of animation is very appropriate for the overall feel of PSG.

The other great thing about art is how they combine absolutely different visual styles in the show. There are several scenes (like renowned Anarchy sisters' transformation sequence, which is amazingly cute and hilarious) and even whole episodes ("Vomiting Point") drawn completely dissimilar to the main cartoony style of the show.


Sound

The soundtrack for PSG is represented by various styles of dance electronic music like house, techno and breakbeat. And it fits the atmosphere perfectly, helping viewers to feel the extreme pace of the storytelling. Some of songs are pretty memorable and most likely will spin in your mind for long time after you finish watching PSG - for example, famous Anarchy sisters' transformation theme "Fly Away", music video score "D City Rocks" and lyrically romantic dubstep-influenced track "Chocolat".

The other thing done great is voicing, both original and official english dub. Characters yell like crazy all the time and swear a lot just like some freaks like them should. I personally consider the english dub being somewhat even better than the original dub. The voices of Anarchy sisters sound even more naughty and characters' speech involves even more swearing ("Repent, motherfuckers!"), and that's definitely better - hey, it's PSG we're speaking of.


Characters

Probably characters are not the best aspect of PSG -  it's pretty hard to sympathize with any of them because protagonists and antagonists both are mostly depraved freaks, they barely get any development in the series and their behaviour and personalities are quite random. Nevertheless, all the characters really funny and memorable, and that appears to be enough.


Enjoyment

Hard to speak of it clearly, cause this show is very controversial. Of course, PSG is not appropriate for everyone, even more than this - I'm pretty sure the majority of anime watchers wouldn't enjoy it. I can understand those who disliked or even hated the show - there are a plenty of reasons for this, like unappealing art, stupid dirty jokes and nonsense story. But if you're OK with that, PSG will impress you with its freshness and originality, unforgettable visual style, lots of well-made parodies, great sound and mesmerizing action scenes. What's beyond any doubt - there is not a single boring moment in the whole show, and it keeps you entertained till the last minute.


So, what do I have to say in conclusion? Yes, this show is stupid, yes it lacks common sense big time, its story and characters are not perfect. But you know what? There will hardly ever be another show like PSG - with its striking freshness, amazing action and crazy comics-like feel. So in my opinion it's worth a 8 at least. 

Also, if you enjoyed Dead Leaves or Detroit Metal City - I would strongly recommend you to watch PSG as well, and vice versa.


Please notify me if there's any mistakes, or leave feedback. Stay cool!
